key_insight: AgentIAD augments a single vision-language model with tool-driven, multi-stage inspection—using a Perceptive Zoomer and a comparative tool—to sensitively detect subtle, localized industrial defects by explicitly comparing candidates to canonical normal patterns.
problem_solved: Addresses the failure of single-pass VLMs to find small, localized anomalies and the lack of explicit comparison to normal references, especially when normal samples are scarce.
method: Agentic multi-stage inspection: a single agent iteratively invokes tools instead of relying on one-shot VLM outputs.
Perceptive Zoomer (PZ): focused, high-resolution zooming and fine-grained analysis of suspicious regions.
Comparative module: explicit comparison between candidate regions and canonical normal patterns to expose subtle deviations.
impact: Makes industrial anomaly detection more sensitive, interpretable, and robust under limited normal data, enabling practitioners to catch small defects and produce actionable inspection traces for quality control.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram showing the agent loop: input image → region proposal → Perceptive Zoomer → comparative check → final decision

paper_title: AgentIAD: Tool-Augmented Single-Agent for Industrial Anomaly Detection
paper_authors: Junwen Miao, Penghui Du, Yi Liu, Yu Wang, Yan Wang
